info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY AND NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sharpsburg, or near Pittsburgh, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Ross Township, Monroeville, Shaler Township, Plum, Murrysville, Hampton Township, Wilkinsburg, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, and Harrison Township. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 44 and 57. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 79 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
